column4: Okay whats the magic shortuct that I bumped that disabled my touchpad?
It works fine at the GDM screen but soon as a login mouse is disabled.
It is probably an FN key plus a F<number here> key
It was prolly disabled by a hotkey
I have a button that can disable right above the touchpad its not disabled because the light isn't lit. The pad works fine on GDM just right after I login it stops working.
Hmm. That is odd. What kind of touchpad is it?
I was working in a gnome-terminal ssh'd in to another box earlier and it just went crayz.
by crazy I mean scrreen flickerd and mouse pointer stoped responding. But keyboard was fine.
Hmm. That is odd. What kind of touchpad is it?
let me check i'm not sure who makes it its on an hp laptop
It is probably synaptics then.
yeah its using synaptics and there is some macintosh button emulation on. Which i think might be the culprit. although I have no idea how I could have turne dit on with keypresses.
type `gconf-editor` in a terminal
yeah any idea what key i'm looking for in there?
desktop > gnome > peripherals > touchpad
it was disabled
how could I have done that with keyboard
I have no idea lol that is random. usually if there is not an fn key it is the button above it, which you stated was on. I have no idea.
Is it re-enabled?
yeah its a bug from resuming after bumping the button. I can recreate it.
I'll look at filing it later
As long as it works now lol
yeah but definately a bug.
xangua has no issues lol
